translations: 使迷路，使迷途；使困惑，使迷惑；令走向歧途
更野的；更荒凉的；更狂暴的

sentences.sentence: Among the writers of the plays in this collection, Paul Green, Susan Glaspell, Maxwell Anderson, Thornton Wilder, William Saroyan, and Tennessee Williams have all received Pulitzer Prizes for their contributions to the theater.
sentences.translation: 在这部戏剧作品集的作者中，保罗·格林、苏珊·格拉斯佩尔、麦克斯韦·安德森、桑顿·怀尔德、威廉·萨罗扬和田纳西·威廉姆斯都因其对戏剧的贡献而获得普利策奖。

sentences.sentence: The wailing grew wilder and wilder.
That relative strength would be consistent with what was seen in the wilder retail industry during the early part of the holiday season.
sentences.translation: 这一相对强劲的势头将与假日季早期更疯狂的零售行业的表现相符。
